title: Adjacent Land Use
description: Requirements for assessing and mitigating risks from adjacent land use including intensive livestock operations, domestic/wild animals, manure storage, high-risk operations, and fecal contamination

requirements.text: Is there evidence of intensive livestock production (e.g., feedlots, dairy operations, poultry houses, meat rendering operation) on adjacent or nearby land? If No, go to 2.04.02.
mandatoryStatements: Adjacent land use is surveyed and documented
Presence of intensive livestock operations is identified
Information gathering for risk assessment purposes
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of adjacent land use
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly monitoring of adjacent land changes

requirements.text: Where there is intensive livestock production on the adjacent land, have appropriate measures been taken to mitigate this possible contamination source onto the growing area (e.g., buffer areas, physical barriers, foundation, fences, ditches, etc.)?
mandatoryStatements: Risk from adjacent intensive livestock operation has been assessed
Buffer areas are established between livestock operation and growing areas
Physical barriers (fences, berms, vegetation) are installed where appropriate
Ditches or drainage controls prevent runoff from livestock area reaching growing areas
Mitigation measures are effective in preventing contamination
Measures are inspected and maintained regularly
Enhanced monitoring is conducted in growing areas nearest to livestock operation
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly inspection of barriers and buffer zones, verification after heavy rain
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of mitigation measures, immediate action if barriers compromised

requirements.text: Is there evidence of domestic animals and/or wild animals (includes homes with hobby farms, and non-commercial livestock) on adjacent or nearby land? If No, go to 2.04.03.
mandatoryStatements: Presence of domestic or wild animals on adjacent land is identified
Type and proximity of animals is documented
Information gathering for risk assessment purposes
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of adjacent land animal presence
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly monitoring of adjacent property conditions

requirements.text: Where there are domestic and/or wild animals (includes homes with hobby farms, and non-commercial livestock) have physical measures been put in place to restrain the animals and their waste from entering the growing area (e.g., vegetative strips, windbreaks, physical barriers, berms, fences, diversion ditches)?
mandatoryStatements: Physical measures prevent animal access to growing areas
Fencing or barriers are properly maintained
Vegetative strips or windbreaks provide additional protection where appropriate
Berms or ditches control drainage from animal areas
Measures effectively restrain both animals and their waste
Barriers are inspected regularly for damage or breaches
Repairs to barriers are made promptly
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly inspection of physical barriers and exclusion measures
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of barriers, immediate repair if breaches detected

requirements.text: Is there evidence of untreated animal manure piles, compost, biosolids, or non-synthetic amendment stored and/or applied on adjacent land? If No, go to 2.04.04.
mandatoryStatements: Adjacent land is monitored for presence of manure, compost, or biosolids
Storage and application activities on adjacent land are documented
Information gathering for risk assessment purposes
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly monitoring of adjacent land activities
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly observation of adjacent land for manure/compost presence

requirements.text: Where present, have physical measures been taken to secure untreated animal manure piles, compost, biosolids, or non-synthetic amendment stored and/or applied on adjacent land?
mandatoryStatements: Physical barriers prevent runoff from manure/compost areas reaching growing areas
Berms, ditches, or drainage controls are in place
Vegetative buffers provide additional protection
Coordination with adjacent landowner on containment measures
Measures are effective during rain events
Barriers are inspected and maintained regularly
Enhanced monitoring after applications on adjacent land
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly inspection of containment measures, verification after heavy rain
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of barriers, increased monitoring during and after adjacent land applications

requirements.text: If biosolids are stored and/or applied on adjacent land, has the adjacent landowner supplied paperwork confirming the biosolids meet prevailing guidelines, governmental, or local standards?
mandatoryStatements: Documentation from adjacent landowner confirms biosolids meet regulatory standards
Paperwork includes biosolids source and treatment information
Biosolids meet EPA Part 503 or equivalent local standards
Pathogen reduction requirements are met
Documentation is obtained before or during adjacent land application
Records are maintained for review
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of biosolids documentation from adjacent landowner
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Request updated documentation when biosolids applications occur on adjacent land

requirements.text: Is the growing area situated in a higher risk location where contamination could occur from nearby operations or functions (e.g., leach fields, runoff or potential flooding from sewers, toilet systems, industrial facilities, worker housing, etc.)? If No, go to 2.04.05.
mandatoryStatements: Nearby operations and functions are surveyed and documented
High-risk contamination sources are identified
Information gathering for risk assessment purposes
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of nearby operations and risk sources
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly monitoring of nearby high-risk areas

requirements.text: Where the growing area is situated in a higher risk location, have appropriate measures been taken to mitigate risks related to nearby operations?
mandatoryStatements: Risk assessment identifies specific risks from nearby operations
Mitigation measures are implemented based on identified risks
Physical barriers or buffer zones are established where needed
Drainage controls prevent contaminated runoff reaching growing areas
Enhanced monitoring is conducted in high-risk areas
Contingency plans exist for contamination events
Regular inspection of mitigation measures occurs
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly inspection of risk mitigation measures
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of control effectiveness, increased monitoring during high-risk periods

requirements.text: Is there evidence of any other potential risks in the adjacent land that could potentially lead to contamination of the growing area?
mandatoryStatements: Comprehensive survey of adjacent land risks is conducted
Any additional risk sources are identified and documented
Information gathering for risk assessment purposes
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of all adjacent land risks
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly monitoring for new or changing risks

requirements.text: Have appropriate measures been taken to mitigate risks related to nearby operations?
mandatoryStatements: All identified adjacent land risks have appropriate mitigation measures
Measures are specific to the type and severity of risk
Implementation is verified and documented
Effectiveness of measures is monitored
Measures are maintained and updated as needed
Records demonstrate ongoing risk management
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification of risk mitigation effectiveness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Ongoing monitoring per risk assessment, immediate action if control failures detected

requirements.text: Is there evidence of human fecal matter in the adjacent land to the audited area? If No, go to 2.05.01.
mandatoryStatements: Adjacent land is monitored for human fecal contamination
Any evidence is immediately documented
Information gathering for risk assessment purposes
requirements.verificationExpectations: Regular inspection of adjacent land visible from operation
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of adjacent land, immediate escalation if human fecal matter detected

requirements.text: Where there is evidence of human fecal matter in the adjacent land, are there adequate controls in place to mitigate risk (e.g., access controls (barriers), distance from the growing area and equipment, crop type and maturity, land condition, etc.)?
mandatoryStatements: Immediate communication with adjacent landowner to address issue
Physical barriers prevent access from adjacent land to growing areas
Adequate buffer distance is maintained
Enhanced monitoring of growing areas nearest to contamination
Crop type and maturity are considered in risk assessment
Land condition and drainage patterns prevent contamination migration
Enhanced food safety measures in affected areas
Ongoing monitoring until adjacent land contamination is resolved
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily monitoring while adjacent land contamination exists
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring, daily inspection of barriers and buffer zones, immediate escalation if risk increases

capaInject: If adjacent intensive livestock poses risk and no mitigation: immediately assess risk, implement barriers/buffers within 30 days, do not harvest nearest growing areas until controls verified
If domestic/wild animals from adjacent land can access growing area: immediately repair barriers, conduct daily inspections until barriers secure
If manure/compost runoff from adjacent land reaches growing area: immediate containment, communication with adjacent landowner, implement enhanced barriers within 30 days
If biosolids on adjacent land lack documentation: obtain documentation from adjacent landowner within 14 days or escalate concerns to management
If high-risk location without adequate controls: immediate risk assessment, implement mitigation measures within 30 days based on risk level
If human fecal matter on adjacent land: immediate communication with adjacent landowner, establish enhanced barriers, daily monitoring, do not harvest nearest growing areas until risk mitigated
traceabilityInject: Adjacent land use survey must be traceable to survey dates and findings
Risk assessments for adjacent land must be traceable to specific risks and mitigation measures
Biosolids documentation must be traceable to adjacent landowner and application dates
Monitoring records for adjacent land risks must be traceable to inspection dates and findings
